hypothesis_content.title: Liquidity Gap Reversal After News-Driven Selloff
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC experiences a >5% intraday drop on negative macro news (US budget crisis, regulatory headlines) but funding rates remain neutral/positive and spot volumes spike >150% of 20-day average, price will mean-revert 70% of the drop within 48 hours as opportunistic liquidity enters.
hypothesis_content.rationale: October's 'liquidity crash' created structural gaps where panic selling met thin order books. In neutral/bull regimes, institutional and algorithmic buyers systematically exploit these dislocations when funding doesn't indicate leveraged washout.
entry_conditions: BTC 1D close down >5% from previous close
Negative macro news headline confirmed (Bloomberg, Reuters)
Perpetual funding rate between -0.01% and +0.02% (not capitulation)

exit_conditions.take_profit: Price reaches 70% retracement of the initial drop
exit_conditions.stop_loss: Price makes new 24h low after entry

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: If >5% drops with neutral funding consistently lead to further declines (>80% of cases) rather than reversals over next 30-day sample.
